alert.note: Alert for Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:37AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Etowah County through 515 AM CDT... At 436 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gadsden, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Hokes Bluff, Glencoe, Reece City, Ballplay, Gadsden Mall, Noccalula Falls, Neely Henry Lake, Southside, Gadsden Steam Plant, Big Wills Creek, Crudup, Gadsden Municipal Airport, Keener, Cobb City, Black Creek, Gadsden Water Works and Northside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
